title: N.Y. wants to join legal fight against Trump's refugee ban
text:
New York wants to join other cities in battle against President Trump’s refugee ban N.Y. wants to join legal fight against Trump's refugee ban New York City wants to join Los Angeles, Chicago, and other cities in battling Trump's refugee ban. (Andrew Harrer/ZUMAPRESS.com)  08 PM 
New York City and a coalition of local governments across the country want to join in on the legal fight against President Trump’s refugee ban. 
The city Law Department asked Brooklyn Federal Judge Carol Bagley Amon on Monday for permission to submit a filing in the case for the coalition, which tentatively includes places like Los Angeles and Chicago. 
The city said the proposed filing would show how Trump’s executive order threatened to "damage cities' longstanding efforts to integrate immigrants and welcome visitors into their communities." The city said the amicus filing would also show how the executive order weakened cities' economies, social institutions and "undercut" law enforcement efforts. The city Law Department asked Brooklyn Federal Judge Carol Bagley Amon for permission to submit a filing to create a coalition of governments to fight the refugee ban. (Mary Altaffer/AP) 
Meanwhile, the country's elite universities are also banding together to argue against the executive order. The list of higher education who's who — schools like Princeton, Yale, Harvard and Columbia — are also asking Amon to consider their perspective.

The 17 schools say they seek to educate future leaders and strive to attract top flight faculty, scholars and students from all over the globe. "The Executive Order at issue in this case threatens that ability, and creates significant hardship for amici's valued international students, faculty, and scholars," their filing says. Tags:
